meanings.definition: The process by which a cell releases substances from vesicles through fusion with the cell membrane.
meanings.sent1: Exocytoses help cells send out important materials.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study exocytoses to understand how cells communicate.
meanings.sent3: The cell's exocytoses were like a tiny delivery service.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city of the cell, exocytoses act as the couriers.
meanings.sent5: Imagine exocytoses as tiny messengers carrying secret packages.

meanings.definition: The act of exocytosing substances from a cell.
meanings.sent1: The exocytoses of hormones play a vital role in the body.
meanings.sent2: During exocytoses, the cell expels waste to stay healthy.
meanings.sent3: The exocytoses of the cell were like a tiny spring cleaning.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of life, exocytoses are the performers on stage.
meanings.sent5: Visualize exocytoses as tiny helpers tidying up the cell.
